content: Write a short email in an official way.
Write an email to a newly hired content analyst informing him/her that she was hired & she is to begin work next week. Describe her duties in 2-3 sentences.

chosen:
Subject: Welcome to the Team!
Dear [New Hire's Name],
We are thrilled to have you join our team as a Content Analyst. You will be responsible for reviewing and analyzing various types of content, such as text, images, videos, etc., to ensure they meet our quality standards and comply with our policies. Your role also includes identifying any potential issues or violations and taking appropriate action. We believe your expertise in this field combined with your attention to detail and ability to work efficiently make you an ideal fit for this position.
Please note that your first day of work will be on [date]. Please arrive at least 15 minutes early so we can go over some important details regarding your training program and get you set up with all necessary tools and resources. If you have any questions or concerns before then, please don't hesitate to reach out to me or anyone else on my team. Thank you again for joining us and we look forward to working together soon.
Best regards,
[Your name]
rejected:
Subject: Welcome Aboard! 

Dear [New Hire's Name],  

We are thrilled to have you join our team as the new Content Analyst. Your role will involve analyzing and evaluating various types of written material, such as blog posts, social media updates, and website copy, to ensure they meet our quality standards. You'll also be responsible for providing feedback on these materials, identifying areas for improvement, and suggesting ways to make them more engaging and effective. Additionally, you may be asked to assist with other tasks related to content creation or editing. We're confident that your skills and experience will contribute significantly to the success of our company. 

Please note that your first day of work will be [date]. Please arrive at least 15 minutes early so we can complete some paperwork and get you settled into your workspace. If you have any questions or concerns before then, please don't hesitate to reach out to me or anyone else on my team. Again, welcome to the team - we look forward to working together!   

Best regards,  
[Your Name]   
Content Manager.
